alert.note: Alert for Coastal Charlotte; Coastal Hillsborough; Coastal Lee; Coastal Manatee; Coastal Sarasota; DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Inland Charlotte; Inland Hillsborough; Inland Lee; Inland Manatee; Inland Sarasota; Pinellas; Polk (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 19 at 3:54AM EDT until April 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...Critically low humidity, elevated and gusty northerly winds, and high ERC values will result in Red Flag conditions today... .Humidity values falling into the 25 to 30 percent range combined with a breezy northerly wind flow and high ERC values will support Red Flag conditions over west central and southwest Florida today. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST FLORIDA... The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Area - Ruskin FL has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 8 PM EDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Pinellas...Polk...Hardee...Highlands... DeSoto...Coastal Hillsborough...Coastal Manatee...Coastal Sarasota...Coastal Charlotte...Coastal Lee...Inland Hillsborough...Inland Manatee...Inland Sarasota...Inland Charlotte...Inland Lee. * WIND...North winds sustained around 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...25-30 percent. * ERC...30 to 50. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
